title: Choosing Your Career Path
description: Finding the right career is a journey of self-discovery matched with practical research. It's about aligning what you love with what you're good at and what the world needs.
sentences: Start with self-assessment: identify your interests, skills, values, and personality type.
Research different industries and roles to understand the day-to-day realities and future outlook.
Conduct informational interviews with professionals in fields that interest you.
Gain practical experience through internships, volunteering, or personal projects.
Understand that a career path isn't always linear; it's okay to pivot and adapt.
dos: Talk to a career counselor for guidance.
Build a 'career board' of ideas and possibilities.
Learn a new skill that is in high demand.
Network actively both online and offline.
donts: Don't choose a career based solely on salary or parental pressure.
Don't ignore your intuition or 'gut feeling'.
Don't be afraid to start over or change your mind.
Don't limit your research to just a few popular roles.
